com.camerontec.util.spring.components

Interface IPerformsRecurringTask

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IExecutable, Runnable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ICascader
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseAutoStartableComponentPerformingRecurringTask, BaseExecutableComponentPerformingRecurringTask, Cascader

    public interface IPerformsRecurringTask
extends IExecutable, Runnable
    This interface is implemented by executable components that repeatedly execute a task with a given periodicity.
    • The task to be executed is specified by method Runnable.run() and is executed in a separate thread.
    • The task is started when this IExecutable is started and is stopped when this IExecutable is stopped.
    • When starting, the first execution of the task is delayed by the amount of time given by getInitialDelay().
    • The task is then executed with a fixed delay given by getPeriodicity().
    • The unit in which the task's periodicity and initial delay are expressed is given by getTimeUnit().
    Author:
    Guillaume Jacob (guillaume.jacob@orcsoftware.com)
